citeinfo.title: Oshoro Maru cruise 42 to the Bering Sea in May - July 1953

descript.abstract: Meteorological observations: every three-hours-interval, coving the whole course measurement of surface temperature, every hour-interval, covering the whole course Hydrographics cast. At 22 stations, covering depths from the surface to usually 1500m. Cast to 0.10, 20, 30, 50, 75, 100, 150, 200, 300, 400, 500, 600, 800, 1000, 1200 and 1500m, in length of wire paid out. In deep cast each Nansen bottle carried out two protected thermometers and an unprotected thermometer. At 22 stations and also each two stations between two successive stations of them, temperature and current measurement were carried with BT and GEK. Also included Analyses of water samples, Radio-activity of sea water, Plankton sampling, Fish larvae tow, salmon gill-net operation, measurement of biological characters on fish caught by salmon gill-net fishing, measurement of light absorption of sea water in situ and measurement of total radioactivity of sea water.
descript.purpose: Purpose is to record of oceanographic observation & exploratory fishing - No.3, in November 1959

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system.
